query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

project.teaser: Aeromecannica, is a well-stablished Italian SME company with 40 years’ experience in the design and fabrication of fans and blowers, with a strong presence at international level. In this Phase 1, we aim to determine the financial and technical viability of the...
project.objective: Aeromecannica, is a well-stablished Italian SME company with 40 years’ experience in the design and fabrication of fans and blowers, with a strong presence at international level. In this Phase 1, we aim to determine the financial and technical viability of the industrialisation process of a low energy consumption turbofan for fluid concentrations with pressures over 15,000 Pa. Target sectors include the Food & Beverage, Chemical and Petrochemical Industries. We propose an innovative impeller design that allows the flow to go through the impeller free of turbulences, thus improving aerodynamic efficiency. The main advantage is the consistent reduction of the absorbed power resulting in an increase of energy up to 15% more than the existing competitors in the market for similar applications and a 33% saving on capital investment. Thanks to this new design, the European targeted industries will be able to commit with the regulatory framework and reduce the operation costs, making them more competitive face to international markets. We will not offer a single product to the market, but a range of products to satisfy the demands of different clients avoiding oversized products. With a scaled-up prototype already manufactured and tested, in Phase 2, will develop 3 serial products for different flow rates: <50,000 m3/h; 50,000 -100,000 m3/h and >100,000 m3/h and design the final automated manufacturing line. Within this Phase 1, Fully assess reliable cost forecast for the final automatic manufacturing line to be installed in Phase 3 and definition of the financial strategy implementations. We will also draft the principal lines of our commercialisation strategy to launch STRANICH F3000 to the Italian and European markets (from the Italian and French agencies). We expect a payback period of 3 years, a Return of Investment (ROI) of 2.31 in year 5, with a cumulated turnover of € 11,57 million in 2024.
project.title: STRANICH F3000: AN ENERGY EFFICENT INDUSTRIAL TURBOFAN FOR HIGH PRESSURE APPLICATIONS REQUIREMENTS

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Package of short-term hazard modelling
result.description: Package of modelling tools and local datasets produced in Task 3.4, regarding local hazards, specifically of flooding, and their occurrence probabilities. WP1 results are used for the local assessment of hazards. It consists of a complete hydrological-hydraulic model set up to simulate urban flooding scenarios, for main hazard situations with different occurrence probability, as determined from the clustering tools of D3.5. Data and tools from D3.1 and D3.3 are also inputs of this deliverable, as well as additional local observations from the WP4 activities, relevant to the specific objective.

project.teaser: The International Maritime Organisation will soon mandate use of ballast water treatment (BWT) systems in all ships over 300T, of which over 31,000 are predicted to be retrofit with electrochlorination systems. However, existing power supply technologies for...
project.objective: The International Maritime Organisation will soon mandate use of ballast water treatment (BWT) systems in all ships over 300T, of which over 31,000 are predicted to be retrofit with electrochlorination systems. However, existing power supply technologies for electrochlorination are very bulky, requiring most ships to be cut and extending retrofit times far beyond the mandatory scheduled dry dock period that ships must take every 5 years. A fundamental barrier to converting all ships during the expected 5 – 8 yr regulatory window exists. Castlet Ltd have developed a novel high current power supply, based on modular power-sharing of 3 – 10 IGBT-controlled high frequency resonant converters. With a step change in performance, scalability and redundancy, the technology also has 9× smaller subsystem size and 3.6× reduction in total volume. This enables installation without structural work to all ships, reducing the days in dock by 60,000 (2022) across the EU shipping industry and cost savings of €2.65 billion. Innovation yields a potential €790 million retrofit opportunity, and a further ongoing €26.3 million/yr market for use in new ships. Within the scope of the overall project, steps required to prepare the enabling technology for market entry include: optimisation of the parallel power sharing architecture; compatibility with different electrochlorination loads; type approval; reliability testing and development of global service framework; extended field trials; value engineering; EU supply chain development; and productionisation. The proposed Phase 1 feasibility study seeks to address these requirements by delivery of an elaborated business plan; prioritised EU market entry strategy; supply chain initiation; production development roadmap; logistics planning and service models; robust OEM engagements to develop core compatibility; IP strategy and value model; as well as technical, regulatory and value engineering roadmaps for the final phase of developments.
project.title: Safeguarding shipping operations via a novel modular high frequency power converter to boost installation and performance of ballast water treatment systems

result.title: Map and report of key climate-change hazards
result.description: This report will deal with past extreme events in coastal cities, the identification of key hazards and the high-level analysis of baseline exposure and vulnerability to climate impacts, not least sea level rise, based on the work in Tasks 1.2. Past extreme climate events in the CCLLs (including all frontrunners and followers) will be mapped, and key climate-related hazards identified and categorised under existing climatic conditions.

result.description: Report on the interface control for the system This deliverable describes the interfaces and protocols that will be implemented to make all GIS Based Early Warning and Digital Twin Platform subsystems exchange information and commands internal interfaces The deliverable will also describe the interfaces that will have to be realized in order to make the GIS Based Early Warning and Digital Twin Platform interact with other entities eg external data sources sensors presentation interface data collection etc

result.title: Package of models for the long-term evolution of the coastline
result.description: Modelling tools and local datasets produced in Task 3.5, for the long-term evolution of the coastline and uncertainties, estimated by the study of local morphodynamic processes and climatic projections. It contains a hybrid 2D/3D modelling chain, for sediment transport processes connected to hydrodynamic models at the storm scale. Data and tools from D3.1, D3.3 and D3.5 are inputs of this deliverable, as well as WP1 results and additional local observations from the WP4 activities, relevant to the specific objective.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Report of baseline risk analysis
result.description: Semi-quantitative risk maps will be produced for all CCLLs based on the outcomes of the baseline risk analysis carried out in this task. Risk maps are graphical representations of the spatial distribution of the likelihood of exceeding certain thresholds of economic losses. This estimation of likelihood will be provided in semi-quantitative terms, for example through a score from 1 to 10, where 1 indicates low risk and 10 indicate high risk. A brief report will also be produced, describing the methodology followed to produce the risk maps.

result.title: Exposure database and vulnerability curves for the frontrunner CCLLs
result.description: The exposure databased will be delivered in a standard format (csv table, shapefile, access database or any other internationally-accepted format) and will include a list of assets, their geographical coordinates, their description and the categorisation of their most important risk-related features. The vulnerability functions will be delivered in a standard format (csv table or any other text format) and will include the characterisation of the vulnerability for all the typologies included in the exposure database.

result.title: Package of downscaling analysis tools
result.description: Set of downscaling models and coastal-scale datasets produced in Task 3.2. from the selected time series of D3.1, in particular, for coastal hydrodynamics and waves nested on climate services, to build local coastal scale solutions. It contains ready-to-use models and tools for downscaling regional simulations to the local coastline.

result.title: Communication materials package
result.description: Creation of a full communication material package (logo, visual identity, communication templates, flyers, banners, etc.), including a project website, social media and videos. The website will provide access to the publications and other material arising from the project, as well as present interactive material such as promotional videos produced for dissemination purposes. A LinkedIn community will be developed with support of all partners to maximize stakeholder engagement as indicated in T8.1. The objective of the website, social media and other communication material will be to display the project’s vision, implementation of activities and results throughout the project. All communication means and materials will be designed and prepared in accordance with the target groups identified and favoured communication channels. A flexible approach will allow adaptation of the material during the course of the project (e.g. printing of flyers on demand). The BBI JU logo, EC and BIC emblems will be visible on all communication material, indicating their funding of the project.

result.title: Policy proposal for measures within CAP for fostering algae production
result.description: a report with specific proposals will be made to pave the way to a smooth integration of microalgae production within the future schemes for supporting wine producers. Also will be considered provisions that USA has recently incorporated in the support schemes for wine producers, through Algae agriculture act (2018) and new Farm Bill(2018). It develops actions in insurances, R&D programs and private engagement to provide algae based new products. Local policy analyses will be developed, supported by REDWine partners.
